title: Vin Diesel talks about Paul Walker's death: 'I feel blessed that I'm able to talk about how wonderful he was' - Showbiz
text: Vin Diesel has spoken about Paul Walker's death in an emotional interview.In tonight's (October 17) episode of The Jonathan Ross Show, the star opened up about his friend's death. © Getty Images / SGranitz/WireImage "The relationships in that franchise are so strong and the brotherhood so real that it transcends the experience of making the movie," Diesel noted."You spend 15 years going from being a nobody to being a somebody with a brother and then one day he's gone and it's a heavy experience."I grew up in New York City, being a bouncer and you would lose people while you were working, but this was unlike anything we could have imagined."While he recalled his mother telling him it as unfair he had to "mourn in front of the whole world", the actor now sees it as a blessing. © Universal Pictures "I feel blessed that I'm able to carry on and talk about how wonderful a person he was and how special a person he was," he said."He's really the best of us, he was that selfless and he was such an important figure in my life."Diesel also spoke about the reasons behind naming his daughter Pauline in honour of the late actor.Walker had given him some advice when he was about to become a father for the first time, urging Diesel to "go into that delivery room, be present and cut that umbilical cord". © facebook.com/VinDiesel "Six months ago, when I was blessed to be in that same situation, I couldn't help but remember Paul and his advice," he explained."As I'm cutting the umbilical cord, I'm thinking to myself it's all because Paul Walker told me to go into the delivery room."Once it came time to sign the name, I started writing 'Paul' and then just added I-N-E."Last week, Diesel revealed that working on his new film The Last Witch Hunter was "therapeutic" in coping with Walker's death.The Jonathan Ross Show airs tonight at 10.15pm on ITV.
